website_summaries.verdict: In terms of single-GPU performance, the Nvidia GeForce GTX Titan dominates every other video card on the market.
pros: The best single-GPU performance money can buy
cons: At $999, only a small number of people can afford one

customer_reviews.title: A real powerhouse (in every sense of the word)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these because I like to play the Battlefield series in three screen wide-angle mode and they have been perfect for that, yielding good frame rates and smooth, stutter-free gameplay. In truth, there are better values in graphics bang for the buck but I was willing to pay the rather steep tariff for the ultimate graphics experience and I haven't been disappointed. These cards tend to run right at their rated temperature limit of 80C but they have been flawless and reliable. For those who want the very best and don't mind paying for it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Cuda core heaven
customer_reviews.text: Used unit was in excellent condition. What I wanted were the cuda cores and the price was right. After benchmarking with this card my PC was roughly equivalent to an i5 with a GTX 970. I have an i7 3770 on an H77 board, so it's older and not designed with OC in mind. I'm very happy with the Adobe Premiere encoding speed which was dramatically faster than before.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Powerful yet affodrable.
customer_reviews.text: Love this card, bought it for my custom gaming rig and have had no issues with it whatsoever. Would definitely purchase this again if it was available.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lovejoy

customer_reviews.title: Good GPU but was overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Been using 2 of these for the past 7 years and had absolutely no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jasem

customer_reviews.title: Fastest Single GPU on the planet..
customer_reviews.text: Got this working on my Mini ITx Prodigy Setup.. Proc: Intel i7 3770k Memory: corsair Vengeance 16gb Board: Asus P8Z77-I Deluxe Case: Bitfenix Prodigy Hello DCWIRED from Davao, Philippines.. :D Clobitto
customer_reviews.author: Clobitto

customer_reviews.title: Great Card, Awful Service
customer_reviews.text: The card is great except that it was clearly used, but advertised as new. It took 3 and a half weeks to get here and was missing several things out of the box. Order this card from somewhere else!!! it was far too expensive for how old this card is!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very, very impressive video card
customer_reviews.text: This video card give me goosebumps, very powerful video card blows away ps4, xbox x1, by far... I play all my game maximum power and this card is not even twitching everything works very smooth, the only inconvenience for many people is the price very expensive but like i say: what you buy is what you get, if you wan't the best you got to pay, so little sacrifice and you going to have a video card for the next 30 years more or less lol.. It hurts in the beginning but when you see what it can do is very amazing.
customer_reviews.author: randy urrea

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for SLI! in WOW im at 100 fps in a 25 man raid with ultra settings,with one card and in other action games it varies up to 200 frames all in the highest ultra settings. Easy to install , tweak software is ok but I have not had to tweak anything for great perfomance.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in looks and performance
customer_reviews.text: It arriving earlier than expected and overclocked it as soon as possible with no hassle and it worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: The fastest single-GPU card ever PERIOD.
customer_reviews.text: This it's the Fastest single GPU Game Card Ever Made. The GeForce Titan is a true processing powerhorse. The GK110 chip carries 14 SMX units with 2688 CUDA cores, boasting up to 4.5 Teraflops of peak compute performance. The Titan features a core configuration that consists of 2688 SPUs, 224 TAUs and 48 ROPs. The card's memory subsystem consists of six 64-bit memory controllers (384-bit) with 6GB of GDDR5 memory running at 6008MHz, which works out to a peak bandwidth of 288.4GB/s -- 50% more than the GTX 680 Waiting for ATI.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome card
customer_reviews.text: When you are running Crysis 3 on ultra graphics without a tiny bit lost of fps, you know you've got the right card.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Liu

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect in Linux, still worth its titanic price
customer_reviews.text: Have installed the card in a linux desktop and have tried some computations. This card seems to be faster than a $3000+ Tesla K20. The installation was also much more trouble-free than my previous Radeon HD 7950 (I had a hard time trying to install AMD driver in linux). It is possible to enable fast double precision in Linux. However, the Linux driver doesn't allow one to change clock frequency, change fan speed, set up a target temperature, or overclock the monitor. These functions are not necessary, but NVIDIA should have added a "windows only" footnote when they advertised about these features.
customer_reviews.author: GeZhang

customer_reviews.title: It runs EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Geforde GTX TITAN, and all I can say is "WOW". Far Cry 3 (On high Graphics), Runs like warms butter over some steaming hot pancakes. Battlefield 3 runs even faster. Minecraft, "Foh-ged-aboud-it" Skyrim, don't even ask (so fast!!!). PhotoShop Runs great. Everything that I had trouble with now runs with ease... This Product is SO worth the $1000 and I am so glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Habib Sheeblaawy

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I used all caps in the title, it is that good! I Bought this after buying a 4k TV and it is incredible! I have been playing Bioshock Infinite on max settings and it looks and plays incredible! If you can afford it, buy it immediately, that is my suggestion! The only down side is that it doesn't come with the same software as it's EVGA counterpart, but you can download the good stuff from EVGA and it works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: SeaWill

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money with that type of warranty/ failure with ...
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these for a system 1.5 years ago, both had hardware failures last week, system is connected to a 1500 WAT UPS yet both are shown g Error Code 43. Talked to NVIDA support they are warranty 1 year. Waste of money with that type of warranty/ failure with what these cost. I would find a diff vendor IMO never again NVIDA.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Just great great great
customer_reviews.text: second best graphics card ive ever used its insane bro but i mean not much better than my gtx 780 but this is still a great card my radeon hd 7990 plays better and is a better graphics card overall but this gtx titan is still a super beast graphics card but if ur gonna game trust me get the radeon hd 7990 the eyefinity on amd cards are way easier it took me 30 min to setup all the stuff but still great card bravo asus! :D
customer_reviews.author: Alpha 7990

customer_reviews.title: What's up with all the negative reviews?
customer_reviews.text: Don't be a hater!!! It's the top of the line right now, what do you expect? At one point the GeForce GTX 480 was top of the line and was priced at $500 plus. Now you can buy it for around $200. IT'S THE WAY TECHNOLOGY IS. I don't hold it against Nvidia or AMD they have to make money. Competition is good.
customer_reviews.author: H0B0Byter99

customer_reviews.title: Excellent card!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance, 85-90% of GTX690 performance BUT without stuttering issue = better overall experience. Definitely a must buy. Double precision performance is also kept the same as the tesla K20x so you can also use it as your own CUDA compute card as well.
customer_reviews.author: amznPrime

customer_reviews.title: better last 10 yrs and more than keep up with next gen consoles..
customer_reviews.text: At this price this card should be last a while. it needs to be future proof and needs to blow ps4 and xbox 720 away. to build a pc with this card is gonna be at least 2000-2500$. i bet new xbox is like $700. and that is guarenteed around 8 yrs of gaming. unless it breaks! whatever. i hate how tech moves so fast. so $$$$$$!!!!
customer_reviews.author: zaybls

product_meta.title: ASUS GeForce GTX TITAN 6GB 384-bit GDDR5 PCI Express 3.0 SLI Support Video Card GTXTITAN-6GD5
product_meta.description: The ASUS GeForce® GTX Titan utilizes a design derived from NVIDIA® Tesla K20X technology. NVIDIA® Tesla graphics cards are popular in supercomputer applications used by graphics professionals, designers, and researchers all over the world. The ASUS GeForce® GTX Titan uses 2688 CUDA cores and a 384-bit memory interface for its 6GB GDDR5 video memory, which is clocked at 6000MHz. As such, it delivers power that can easily handle the most advanced games and multimedia in resolutions above 2560 x 1600. It further supports smooth DirectX® 11.1 performance, even with all effects and graphics settings set to maximum. For gamers and PC graphics enthusiasts, it arrives as the card of choice for next generation entertainment.
feature_bullets: GPU Tweak utility helps you modify and tune clocks (including new boost clock settings), power consumption targets, voltages, and fan performance via an intuitive interface.
Dynamic clock speed maximization based on game workload pushes performance to new levels with NVIDIA GPU Boost 2.0 technology.
Immerse in your game with hardware-based frame metering, ultra-fast TXAA/FXAA advanced antialiasing, and Adaptive Vertical Sync technology.
Transform hundreds of PC games into full stereoscopic 3D with NVIDIA 3D Vision.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.7 out of 5 stars25 ratings2.7 out of 5 stars
